Please specify a TITLE instead of testing junit. I don't know where is this=
 from, but it makes sense to have a proper tile.

Burt

  ----- Original Me=
ssage ----- 
  From: Philippe Vanpeperstraete 
  To: junit@yahoogroups.com =

  Sent: Wednesday, May 30, 2001 11:12 AM
  Subject: RE: [junit] testing ju=
nit


  I just looked up the distribution, that you can download from www.j=
unit.org. At least the zipfile I have (still 3.5) does contain the article.=

    -----Original Message-----
    From: Andrew Zou [mailto:azou@...=
m]
    Sent: woensdag 30 mei 2001 19:07
    To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
   =
 Subject: RE: [junit] testing junit


    I think this link( http://junit.s=
ourceforge.net/doc/cookbook/cookbook.htm) does not work any more. Does any =
body know the mirror site or they moved this page to where.

    Thanks.

 =
   Andrew
      -----Original Message-----
      From: Philippe Vanpeperstr=
aete [mailto:philippe.vanpeperstraete@...]
      Sent: Wednesday, May=
 30, 2001 11:48 AM
      To: junit@yahoogroups.com
      Subject: RE: [juni=
t] testing junit


      Did you look under the "documentation" tab, there,=
 you'll find the JUnit cookbook, which is a pretty good start, if you get y=
our Java environment straight.

      regards
      Philippe
        -----O=
riginal Message-----
        From: Ram Kumar [mailto:y_ramkumar@...=
]
        Sent: woensdag 30 mei 2001 16:33
        To: junit@...=
m
        Subject: Re: [junit] testing junit


        Hi,

        I am a =
new JUnit user and just downloaded JUnit and trying to work with it. I coul=
d not find proper documentation about how to install JUnit and use it, in J=
Unit site.

        Could any one suggest me where to find good documentati=
on about JUnit?

        Awaiting your immediate reply.

        Thanks,

 =
       Yamasani.
